page.title: 01Our D Block
page.content: Our D Block is mostly rural- much of which is rough moorland.The eastern side of our area is part of the Pennine Chain.Scattered about the moors are lots of resevoirs which were constructed for the use of mills.There are also many disused quarries scattered about the moors. Also, there are lots of mills and small pockets of urban developments around them.There is also ribbon development along the roads.Some former cotten mills are not in use and haven't been for a long time,this industry is virtually dead.Others now manufacture other goods.The Rochdale canal runs through our area along the river valley between the hills and years ago was used by the mills to carry equipment.Along the valley also runs a main road into Yorkshire & the railway.
